New Records: Rohit Sharma smashed the fastest century by an India player at a Cricket World Cup, breaking a 40-year record set by Kapil Dev.
Rohit Sharma is the only Cricket World Cup 2023 captain to score a century to this point of the tournament.
Rohit Sharma overtook Ricky Ponting in third place in the total ODI century list, making his 31st ODI hundred.
Rohit Sharma became the batter with the most international sixes across all formats during the clash with Afghanistan, surpassing Chris Gayle with 556 sixes.
Key Match Events: Rohit Sharma scored 131 in just 84 balls, dictating terms at the Arun Jaitley Stadium.
The opening partnership of Rohit and Ishan Kishan put on 156 in 18.4 overs.
Virat Kohli scored 55* and Shreyas Iyer scored 25* to finish the chase.
Rashid Khan (2/57 off eight overs) was the only bowler to make any headway for Afghanistan, with four of his teammates going for eight an over or more.
Post-Match Reflections: Rohit Sharma expressed pride in the team's performance after their comprehensive win over Afghanistan.
India joined New Zealand and Pakistan as teams to start two from two at the tournament.
